name: Avoid using too many CYCLE or/and EXIT statements in Fortran-90 Subroutines  (FORTRAN)
description: Maximum allowed CYCLE and EXIT statements is a threshold and can be changed at will..
rationale: Avoid too many CYCLE or EXIT statements in Fortran-90.  Too many CYCLE and EXIT statements make the code difficult to read and change.
remediation: Reduce the number of CYCLE and EXIT statements by seeking alternative implementations.
alternativeName: Avoid using too many CYCLE or/and EXIT statements in Fortran-90 Subroutines  (FORTRAN)

technicalCriteria.name: Complexity - Algorithmic and Control Structure Complexity

parameters.name: Max. number of CYCLE or EXIT statements
